blog.name: superhero-daugthers11
blog.title: Lady Liberty And Bullet
blog.description: Super teen Amy Carter (daughter of Captain America) and Hayley Allen (daughter of The Flash). Amy’s mom is Peggy carter. Her life interesting to say the least. Amy was born with ability to control and travel through time, which makes it possible for her to grow up with both her parents in her life (even though one lives in the 1940s and other in the 2000s). Hayley grows up in Central City and is trained daily to someday become the new savior of central city. She often fights villains alongside her dad.

summary: “So Dad I been hearing some rumors, from well everyone, saying that you kissed Aunt Sharon at moms funeral. I would like to say...
body:
The kiss (open roleplay)

“So Dad I been hearing some rumors, from well everyone, saying that you kissed Aunt Sharon at moms funeral. I would like to say that that is apsluetly gross and completely disrespectful. I know you and my mom were never technically a couple, but Sharon is still Peggy’s niece. What the hell were you thinking?!“

“So Dad I been hearing some rumors, from well everyone, saying that you kissed Aunt Sharon at moms funeral. I would like to say that that is apsluetly gross and completely disrespectful. I know you and my mom were never technically a couple, but Sharon is still Peggy’s niece. What the hell were you thinking?!“

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Midnight Sun
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2tyO0Lm

by izzzy

(The result of me watching Midnight Sun and watching Stony fanvids an hour later.)

Tony Stark is a 17-year-old boy with a life-threatening sensitivity to sunlight caused by xeroderma pigmentosum, or XP, a rare genetic condition. He has been sheltered since early childhood because of it; away from other people his age, with a routine of sleeping during the day and staying up all night.

Then comes Steve Rogers, the scrawny kid who Tony first saw fighting someone almost twice his size outside his window, holding an arm out to a little girl to keep her behind him. Like a shield. The kid didn’t get too beaten up, but that was only because he sent Jarvis out to help. Since then, he’s been watching the blonde walk past their house from his window, basically watching him transform into an Adonis right before his eyes, dreaming of being able to talk to him.

A song at the train station and a kid giving him a pack of M&Ms later, looks like the dream isnt too far away after all.

But when is life, especially his, ever that simple?

Words: 1050, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
